Class VotingServer

java.lang.Object
core.VotingServer
public class VotingServer extends Object
Represents the Voting Server in the e-voting system.

This class is responsible for:

  • Authenticating voters using their certificates
  • Issuing secure voting tokens to authenticated voters
  • Preventing duplicate voting by tracking used tokens and voted voters
  • Maintaining the list of eligible voters received from the Registration Authority

The Voting Server operates during the voting phase of an election and interacts with the Registration Authority and Ballot Box.

    • updateEligibleVotersList

      public void updateEligibleVotersList(Map<String,Boolean> updatedList)

      Parameters:

    • authenticateVoter

      public String authenticateVoter(X509Certificate cert)
      Authenticates a voter using their certificate.

      This method can only be called during the voting phase. It checks if the voter is eligible, if they have already voted, if the certificate is revoked, and validates their certificate.

      Parameters:
      cert - The voter's X.509 certificate
      Returns:
      A voting token if authentication is successful
      Throws:
      AuthenticationException - If authentication fails

    • validateToken

      public boolean validateToken(String token)
      Validates a voting token.
      Parameters:
      token - The token to validate
      Returns:
      true if the token is valid, false otherwise

    • markTokenAsUsed

      public void markTokenAsUsed(String token)
      Marks a token as used after a vote has been cast.
      Parameters:
      token - The token to mark as used
